WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Just imagine a beast with a lid for a head and fins for feet, running around looking as insane as possible (really imagine it!). When it runs up to you, it shows you the top of its lid-head. On it is written the numbers 666. Why? Because it's a spawn of the devil, and the number six is the devil's number.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this beast doing various crazy things, the crazier the better (to help you remember). Make sure all these things are associated with the devil and the devil's number (six), so you can remember the meaning of this kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
Whenever we need to remember the reading ã‚ã we just use the word rock.
So, think about the devil and the devil's number. What is often associated with those things? Why, rock (ã‚ã) and roll is. Imagine the lid-head fin-legged beast suddenly blasting out rock music in the middle of his destructive mayhem.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Sing along with the monster, if it helps you to remember the reading of this kanji.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Indicating the six parts of the human body: head (top hat), body, 2 arms and 2 legs (animal legs).
origin_of_ch_char_book: A long time ago, there were various types of divinations in the East, and people used a variety of tools for them. (æ•, æ•™, jiao, teach) is combination of four sticks crossed with each other , and a child, hand holding a rod for spanking. This scene shows someone teaching divination using four sticks. Each stick has two sides (front and back) which can make different formations when people throw them on the ground, and fortunes are told depending on their arrangements. (å­¸, å­¦, xue=hsÃ¼ueh, study) Also, in this word, you can see two hands holding something and four sticks to tell fortunes . Add the symbol for â€˜sixâ€™ (å…­, liu, six) which means the number of Changes, or Universe, and a child. All combined, the word shows a scene of a person learning how to tell fortunes by using sticks. This kind of tradition still remains in some parts of Koreans and native Americans. The process of this divination was complex, and people had to learn (å­¸, å­¦, xue, study) or teach (æ•, æ•™, jiao, teach) the way to practice.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The " six " and " entering " in the early Jia Jin inscriptions have the same shape, and they are suspected of being the same character in the ancient version. Later it was borrowed as a numeral, so two pens were added as a differentiation component (see Guo Moruo, Li Xiaoding, Ding Shan). One said that " six " is like a shed and is the original character for " Lu ", which was later borrowed as a numeral (Liu Xinglong). Qiu Xigui believes that at the beginning of the process of writing characters, a small number of popular symbols may be absorbed into characters, and pointed out that " six " may be a symbol used by primitive society to count numbers.

"Shu Wen": "Six, the number of "Yi", Yin changes to six, positive at eight. From entering into from eight. All six belonging to from six." Click here to explain the word in "Yi", the interpretation is not The original meaning of the word "å…­".

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as numerals to indicate the cardinal number. "Heji" 32320: "ğ¤‰²(ç‡) six sheep." It can also express the ordinal number. "Heji" 7775: "The king enters the business in June."

Bronze inscriptions are also used as numerals to indicate the base. Pingâ€™an Junding: "Liuyi Banyanâ€™s Tomb (Heavy)." Chuxitu, or "West Six", was handed down as "Six Divisions" in ancient books, and Yu Ding: "Wang Ming ordered Xiliu (teacher) and Yinba (teacher)". The word is also used as an ordinal number, Yayu Ding: "Only (in) June, the next day of the King's Seventh Sacrifice." The full sentence refers to June, the second day of the King's seventh sacrifice.

The characters of the Warring States Period are used as numerals, "Shangbo Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 30-31: "The quality is ordered, as the six types (rules) and the six Lu, distinguished as five sounds, to determine the sacred (sound) of men and women." Erlu Lu". In addition, "Tsinghua Jane II. "Relationship" Jane 34-35: "In the sixth year of the establishment, Qin Gong led a battle with Hui Gong (in Korea)."

Basic explanation of words
six
liÃ¹
Several names, five plus one (usually capitalized "Lu" on banknotes or receipts): Liushu (six types of characters summed up by analyzing the shape, sound, and meaning of Chinese characters in ancient times). Rokko. Six Arts (a. In ancient times, it refers to the six arts of "ritual", "music", "shooting", "imperial", "book" and "number"; b. Six Classics). Six Desires (Buddhist term, refers to "lust", "appearance desire", "prestigious posture desire", "speech and voice desire", "slender desire", "people want desire"; generally refers to various desires of people). Liuhe ("East", "South", "West", "North", "Up" and "Down" are used to refer to the heavens and the earth and the universe). Six relatives (earlier refers to "father", "mother", "wife", "son", "brother", "brother"; generally refers to all relatives). The Six Classics (six Confucian classics, namely "Poem", "Book", "Yi", "Ritual", "Yue", "Spring and Autumn"). Six livestock (six kinds of domestic animals, refer to "pig", "cattle", "sheep", "horse", "chicken" and "dog"). Six Dynasties (ch ä¿¹) ("Wu", "Eastern Jin", "Song", "Qi", "Liang", "Chen", successively established their capitals in Jiankang, which is now Nanjing City, Jiangsu Province, China, and later also referred to as "Southern and Northern Dynasties" ). Six fu-organs (Chinese medicine refers to "stomach", "gallbladder", "large intestine", "small intestine", "bladder", and "triple burnt"). Six-character poem. Six strings.
The notation of Chinese ancient music score is equivalent to "5" in numbered musical notation.

Meaning Mnemonic
Just imagine a beast with a lid for a head and fins for feet, running around looking as insane as possible (really imagine it!). When it runs up to you, it shows you the top of its lid-head. On it is written the numbers 666. Why? Because it's a spawn of the devil, and the number six is the devil's number.
Imagine this beast doing various crazy things, the crazier the better (to help you remember). Make sure all these things are associated with the devil and the devil's number (six), so you can remember the meaning of this kanji.
